pullRequest.title: TSK-1239: Assertj use in every module
pullRequest.bodyText:
Update of Spring Boot version to 2.4.0
Thus and because it is a rule in our guidelines I exchanged all remaining Assertion (junit) uses with the Assertj framework. Moreover Alphanumeric is deprecated since that version, thus change to MethodName.


 
For the submitter:

 I updated the documentation and will supply links to the specific files
 I did not update the documentation
 I included a link to the SonarCloud branch analysis
 I added a description of changes on the current release notes
 I did not update the current release notes
 I put the ticket in review
 After integration of the pull request, I verified our bluemix test environment is not broken

Verified by the reviewer:

 Commit message format → TSK-XXX: Your commit message.
 Submitter's update to documentation is sufficient
 SonarCloud analysis meets our standards
 Update of the current release notes reflects changes
 PR fulfills the ticket
 Edge cases and unwanted side effects are tested
 Readability

nodes.bodyText: what did you do here? please reset this file

This is not an assertions. This is an assumption.
Please use Assumptions.assumeThat(isPostgres).isTrue(); (with a static import)

This is not an assertions. This is an assumption.
Please use Assumptions.assumeThat(isPostgres).isFalse(); (with a static import)

@gitgoodjhe what the hell is this class? Can we please talk about this?

resetDb() is not annotated with @BeforeEach
class name does not end with Test and thus this class will not be found by surefire.
general setup is questionable
test content is too complicated..
why is the class in taskana-rest-spring and not in taskana-core

Like what the hell?!

commit.message: TSK-1239: All tests now working with Assertj instead of junit Assertion.
